text:
Paul Ryan Pulls Doomed Health Care Bill at Trump’s Request 
Move marks embarrassing defeat for GOP leadership Rosemary Rossi | March 24, 2017 @ 12:43 PM Getty 
The GOP has pulled the Health Care bill replacing the Affordable Care Act. 
“The president has suggested and Ryan has accepted to pull the bill,” MSNBC’s Kelly O’Donnel reports. 
GOP sources told MSNBC and CNN that House Speaker Paul Ryan visited the White House early this morning, presumably to alert the president that they did not have the required votes to replace Obamacare with Trump’s revised healthcare plan. 
With news outlets reporting that 27 in the House are solidly in the “No” camp, with another four are likely to follow, the outcome on the bill that has been in doubt. As of this morning, the approval of the GOP health care plan was at 17 percent. 
“This failure shows the fractures within the GOP,” O’Donnell said. “The president wanted to turn up the pressure to leverage the other members. He did that. Instead of them responding, with support, it seemed that the support was eroding.” 
“Why would you schedule a vote on a bill that is at 17% approval? Have we forgotten everything Reagan taught us?” former Speaker of the House Newt Gingrich tweeted earlier. MSNBC calls it “a failure marked in the official congressional record.” 
More to come…
